intro: Aegilops glabriglumis, commonly known as the glabrous spikelet wild oat, is a grass species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, glabrous (smooth) spikelets and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Due to its close relation to cultivated wheat, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
